name: Open help for keyword
description: Opens the help page for the specified keyword in Vim.

name: Save file as
description: Saves the current file with the specified file name.

name: Close current pane
description: Closes the current pane in Vim.

name: Open a terminal window
description: Opens a terminal window within Vim.

name: Open man page for word under the cursor
description: Opens the man page for the word currently under the cursor.

name: Move cursor left
description: Moves the cursor one character to the left.

name: Move cursor down
description: Moves the cursor one line down.

name: Move cursor up
description: Moves the cursor one line up.

name: Move cursor right
description: Moves the cursor one character to the right.

name: Move cursor down (multi-line text)
description: Moves the cursor down one line, considering wrapped lines as a single line.

name: Move cursor up (multi-line text)
description: Moves the cursor up one line, considering wrapped lines as a single line.

name: Move to top of screen
description: Moves the cursor to the top of the screen.

name: Move to middle of screen
description: Moves the cursor to the middle of the screen.

name: Move to bottom of screen
description: Moves the cursor to the bottom of the screen.

name: Jump forwards to the start of a word
description: Moves the cursor forward to the beginning of the next word.

name: Jump forwards to the start of a word (words can contain punctuation)
description: Moves the cursor forward to the beginning of the next word, considering punctuation as part of the word.

name: Jump forwards to the end of a word
description: Moves the cursor forward to the end of the current word.

name: Jump forwards to the end of a word (words can contain punctuation)
description: Moves the cursor forward to the end of the current word, considering punctuation as part of the word.

name: Jump backwards to the start of a word
description: Moves the cursor backward to the beginning of the previous word.

name: Jump backwards to the start of a word (words can contain punctuation)
description: Moves the cursor backward to the beginning of the previous word, considering punctuation as part of the word.

name: Jump backwards to the end of a word
description: Moves the cursor backward to the end of the previous word.

name: Jump backwards to the end of a word (words can contain punctuation)
description: Moves the cursor backward to the end of the previous word, considering punctuation as part of the word.

name: Move cursor to matching character
description: Moves the cursor to the matching character of a pair, such as parentheses, brackets, or braces. Use :h matchpairs in Vim for more information on supported pairs.

name: Jump to the start of the line
description: Moves the cursor to the very beginning of the current line.

name: Jump to the first non-blank character of the line
description: Moves the cursor to the first non-blank character on the current line.

name: Jump to the end of the line
description: Moves the cursor to the end of the current line.

name: Jump to the last non-blank character of the line
description: Moves the cursor to the last non-blank character on the current line.

name: Go to the first line of the document
description: Moves the cursor to the first line of the document.

name: Go to the last line of the document
description: Moves the cursor to the last line of the document.

name: Go to line 5
description: Moves the cursor to line number 5 in the document.

name: Move to local declaration
description: Moves the cursor to the local declaration of the variable under the cursor (useful for code editing).

name: Move to global declaration
description: Moves the cursor to the global declaration of the variable under the cursor (useful for code editing).

name: Jump to next occurrence of character x
description: Moves the cursor to the next occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.

name: Jump to before next occurrence of character x
description: Moves the cursor to the position before the next occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.

name: Jump to the previous occurrence of character x
description: Moves the cursor to the previous occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.

name: Jump to after previous occurrence of character x
description: Moves the cursor to the position after the previous occurrence of character 'x' on the current line.

name: Repeat previous f, t, F or T movement
description: Repeats the previous f, t, F, or T cursor movement command in the same direction.

name: Repeat previous f, t, F or T movement, backwards
description: Repeats the previous f, t, F, or T cursor movement command in the opposite direction.

name: Jump to next paragraph (or function/block, when editing code)
description: Moves the cursor to the beginning of the next paragraph. When editing code, it moves to the next function or block.

name: Jump to previous paragraph (or function/block, when editing code)
description: Moves the cursor to the beginning of the previous paragraph. When editing code, it moves to the previous function or block.

name: Center cursor on screen
description: Centers the cursor vertically on the screen.

name: Position cursor on top of the screen
description: Positions the cursor at the top of the screen.

name: Position cursor on bottom of the screen
description: Positions the cursor at the bottom of the screen.

name: Move screen down one line (without moving cursor)
description: Scrolls the screen down one line without moving the cursor.

name: Move screen up one line (without moving cursor)
description: Scrolls the screen up one line without moving the cursor.

name: Move screen up one page (cursor to last line)
description: Scrolls the screen up one page and moves the cursor to the last line of the new page.

name: Move screen down one page (cursor to first line)
description: Scrolls the screen down one page and moves the cursor to the first line of the new page.

name: Move cursor and screen down 1/2 page
description: Scrolls the screen down half a page and moves the cursor accordingly.

name: Move cursor and screen up 1/2 page
description: Scrolls the screen up half a page and moves the cursor accordingly.

name: Insert before the cursor
description: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text before the cursor position.

name: Insert at the beginning of the line
description: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text at the beginning of the current line.

name: Insert (append) after the cursor
description: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text after the cursor position.

name: Insert (append) at the end of the line
description: Enters insert mode and starts inserting text at the end of the current line.

name: Append (open) a new line below the current line
description: Opens a new line below the current line and enters insert mode.

name: Append (open) a new line above the current line
description: Opens a new line above the current line and enters insert mode.

name: Insert (append) at the end of the word
description: Moves the cursor to the end of the current word and enters insert mode.

name: Delete the character before the cursor during insert mode
description: Deletes the character before the cursor while in insert mode.

name: Delete word before the cursor during insert mode
description: Deletes the word before the cursor while in insert mode.

name: Add a line break at the cursor position during insert mode
description: Inserts a line break at the current cursor position while in insert mode.

name: Indent (move right) line one shiftwidth during insert mode
description: Indents the current line one shiftwidth to the right while in insert mode.

name: De-indent (move left) line one shiftwidth during insert mode
description: De-indents the current line one shiftwidth to the left while in insert mode.

name: Insert (auto-complete) next match before the cursor during insert mode
description: Inserts the next matching completion before the cursor while in insert mode.

name: Insert (auto-complete) previous match before the cursor during insert mode
description: Inserts the previous matching completion before the cursor while in insert mode.

name: Insert the contents of register x
description: Inserts the contents of register 'x' at the cursor position.

name: Temporarily enter normal mode to issue one normal-mode command x.
description: Temporarily switches to normal mode from insert mode to execute a single normal mode command 'x'. After executing the command, it returns to insert mode.

name: Exit insert mode
description: Exits insert mode and returns to normal mode.

name: Replace a single character
description: Replaces the character under the cursor with the next character typed.

name: Replace more than one character, until ESC is pressed
description: Enters replace mode, allowing you to replace multiple characters until the ESC key is pressed.

name: Join line below to the current one with one space in between
description: Joins the line below the current line to the end of the current line, adding a single space in between.

name: Join line below to the current one without space in between
description: Joins the line below the current line to the end of the current line without adding any space.

name: Reflow paragraph
description: Reflows the current paragraph, adjusting line breaks to fit within the current window width.

name: Switch case up to motion
description: Switches the case of characters (uppercase to lowercase or vice versa) from the cursor position to the end of the specified motion.

name: Change to lowercase up to motion
description: Changes the characters from the cursor position to the end of the specified motion to lowercase.

name: Change to Uppercase
description: Changes text to uppercase up to the specified motion.

name: Change (Replace) Entire Line
description: Replaces the content of the entire current line.

name: Change (Replace) to End of Line
description: Replaces text from the cursor position to the end of the current line.

name: Change (Replace) Entire Word
description: Replaces the entire word under the cursor.

name: Change (Replace) to End of Word
description: Replaces text from the cursor position to the end of the current word.

name: Delete Character and Substitute Text
description: Deletes the character under the cursor and enters insert mode to allow substitution of text (same as cl).

name: Delete Line and Substitute Text
description: Deletes the entire line and enters insert mode to allow substitution of text (same as cc).

name: Transpose Two Letters
description: Transposes the character under the cursor with the character to its right (effectively deleting and pasting).

name: Undo
description: Reverses the last editing action.

name: Restore (Undo) Last Changed Line
description: Restores the last changed line to its state before any modifications were made.

name: Redo
description: Redoes a previously undone change.

name: Repeat Last Command
description: Repeats the last executed command.

name: Start Visual Mode
description: Starts visual mode, allowing you to select text by moving the cursor. Once text is selected, you can perform various commands on it (like yanking/copying).

name: Start Linewise Visual Mode
description: Starts linewise visual mode, which allows you to select entire lines by moving the cursor.

name: Move to Other End of Marked Area
description: While in visual mode, this command moves the cursor to the opposite end of the currently selected area.

name: Start Visual Block Mode
description: Starts visual block mode, allowing you to select a rectangular block of text.

name: Move to Other Corner of Block
description: While in visual block mode, this command moves the cursor to the opposite corner of the selected block.

name: Mark a Word
description: In visual mode, selects the current word.

name: Mark a Block with Parentheses
description: In visual mode, selects a block of text enclosed by parentheses ().

name: Mark a Block with Curly Braces
description: In visual mode, selects a block of text enclosed by curly braces {}.

name: Mark a Block with Angle Brackets
description: In visual mode, selects a block of text enclosed by angle brackets <> (often used for tags).

name: Select Inner Block with Parentheses
description: In visual mode, selects the text within the nearest enclosing parentheses ().

name: Select Inner Block with Curly Braces
description: In visual mode, selects the text within the nearest enclosing curly braces {}.

name: Select Inner Block with Angle Brackets
description: In visual mode, selects the text within the nearest enclosing angle brackets <> (often used for tags).

name: Exit Visual Mode
description: Exits visual mode.

name: Shift Text Right
description: In visual mode, shifts the selected text one indentation level to the right.

name: Shift Text Left
description: In visual mode, shifts the selected text one indentation level to the left.

name: Yank (Copy) Marked Text
description: In visual mode, copies (yanks) the selected text into the clipboard.

name: Delete Marked Text
description: In visual mode, deletes the selected text.

name: Switch Case
description: In visual mode, switches the case (uppercase/lowercase) of the selected text.

name: Change Marked Text to Lowercase
description: In visual mode, changes the selected text to lowercase.

name: Change Marked Text to Uppercase
description: In visual mode, changes the selected text to uppercase.

name: Show Registers Content
description: Displays the contents of all registers.

name: Yank into Register x
description: Copies (yanks) the selected text into the specified register x.

name: Paste Contents of Register x
description: Pastes the contents of the specified register x.

name: Yank into System Clipboard Register
description: Copies (yanks) the selected text into the system clipboard.

name: Paste from System Clipboard Register
description: Pastes the contents of the system clipboard.

name: List of Marks
description: Displays a list of all saved marks.

name: Set Current Position for Mark A
description: Sets the current cursor position as mark A. You can use any letter for the mark name.

name: Jump to Position of Mark A
description: Moves the cursor to the position marked as A.

name: Yank Text to Position of Mark A
description: Copies (yanks) the selected text and places it at the position marked as A.

name: Go to Previous Exit Position
description: Moves the cursor to the position where Vim was last exited.

name: Go to Last Edit Position
description: Moves the cursor to the position when you last edited this file.

name: Go to Last Change Position
description: Moves the cursor to the position of the last change in this file.

name: Go to Position Before Last Jump
description: Moves the cursor to the position before the last jump.

name: List of Jumps
description: Displays a list of all recent jumps.

name: Go to Newer Position in Jump List
description: Moves the cursor to the next newer position in the jump list.

name: Go to Older Position in Jump List
description: Moves the cursor to the next older position in the jump list.

name: List of Changes
description: Displays a list of all recent changes made in the buffer.

name: Go to Newer Position in Change List
description: Moves the cursor to the next newer position in the change list.

name: Go to Older Position in Change List
description: Moves the cursor to the next older position in the change list.

name: Jump to Tag Under Cursor
description: Jumps to the definition of the tag under the cursor.

name: Record Macro a
description: Starts recording a macro and saves it in register 'a'.

name: Stop Recording Macro
description: Stops recording the current macro.

name: Run Macro a
description: Executes the macro stored in register 'a'.

name: Rerun Last Macro
description: Repeats the last executed macro.

name: Yank (Copy) a Line
description: Copies the current line into the default register (").

name: Yank (Copy) 2 Lines
description: Copies the current line and the next line into the default register (").

name: Yank (Copy) Word
description: Copies the characters of the word from the cursor position to the start of the next word into the default register (").

name: Yank (Copy) Word Under Cursor
description: Copies the word under the cursor into the default register (").

name: Yank (Copy) Word with Space
description: Copies the word under the cursor and the space after or before it into the default register (").

name: Yank (Copy) to End of Line
description: Copies the characters from the cursor position to the end of the line into the default register (").

name: Put (Paste) After Cursor
description: Pastes the contents of the default register (") after the cursor.

name: Put (Paste) Before Cursor
description: Pastes the contents of the default register (") before the cursor.

name: Put (Paste) After Cursor and Move
description: Pastes the contents of the default register (") after the cursor and leaves the cursor after the new text.

name: Put (Paste) Before Cursor and Move
description: Pastes the contents of the default register (") before the cursor and leaves the cursor after the new text.

name: Delete (Cut) a Line
description: Deletes the current line and places it in the default register (").

name: Delete (Cut) 2 Lines
description: Deletes the current line and the next line and places them in the default register (").

name: Delete (Cut) Word
description: Deletes the characters of the word from the cursor position to the start of the next word and places them in the default register (").

name: Delete (Cut) Word Under Cursor
description: Deletes the word under the cursor and places it in the default register (").

name: Delete (Cut) Word with Space
description: Deletes the word under the cursor and the space after or before it and places it in the default register (").

name: Delete Lines From 3 to 5
description: Deletes lines 3 through 5.

name: Delete to End of Line
description: Deletes the characters from the cursor position to the end of the line and places them in the default register (").

name: Delete Character
description: Deletes the character under the cursor and places it in the default register (").

name: Indent Line
description: Indents the current line one shiftwidth to the right.

name: De-indent Line
description: De-indents the current line one shiftwidth to the left.

name: Indent Block
description: Indents a block enclosed by parentheses () or curly brackets {}, with the cursor positioned on the opening or closing brace.

name: De-indent Block
description: De-indents a block enclosed by parentheses () or curly brackets {}, with the cursor positioned on the opening or closing brace.

name: Indent Inner Block with ()
description: Indents the inner block enclosed by parentheses ().

name: Indent Block with <> Tags
description: Indents a block enclosed by angle brackets <> (tags).

name: Re-indent 3 Lines
description: Re-indents the current line and the two lines below it.

name: Re-indent Block
description: Re-indents a block enclosed by parentheses () or curly brackets {}, with the cursor positioned on the opening or closing brace.

name: Re-indent Inner Block with {}
description: Re-indents the inner block enclosed by curly brackets {}.

name: Re-indent Entire Buffer
description: Re-indents the entire buffer (all lines in the current file).

name: Paste and Adjust Indent
description: Pastes the contents of the default register (") and adjusts the indentation to match the current line.

name: Write File
description: Saves the current file without exiting Vim.

name: Write File with Sudo
description: Saves the current file using sudo (superuser privileges). This is useful when you don't have write permissions to the file.

name: Write and Quit
description: Saves the current file and exits Vim.

name: Quit
description: Exits Vim. Fails if there are unsaved changes.

name: Force Quit
description: Exits Vim and discards any unsaved changes.

name: Write and Quit All Tabs
description: Saves all open files and exits Vim.

name: Search for Pattern
description: Searches forward for the specified pattern.

name: Search Backward for Pattern
description: Searches backward for the specified pattern.

name: Very Magic Search
description: Searches for the specified pattern using 'very magic' mode, where non-alphanumeric characters are interpreted as special regex symbols without escaping.

name: Repeat Search Forward
description: Repeats the last search in the same direction (forward).

name: Repeat Search Backward
description: Repeats the last search in the opposite direction (backward).

name: Global Replace
description: Replaces all occurrences of 'old' with 'new' throughout the entire file.

name: Global Replace with Confirmation
description: Replaces all occurrences of 'old' with 'new' throughout the entire file, prompting for confirmation before each replacement.

name: Remove Search Highlighting
description: Removes the highlighting of search matches.

name: vim[grep]
description: Searches for a given pattern in multiple files.

name: cn[ext]
description: Jumps to the next match from a previous search.

name: cp[revious]
description: Jumps to the previous match from a previous search.

name: cope[n]
description: Opens a window that displays a list of matches from the previous search.

name: ccl[ose]
description: Closes the quickfix window, which contains the list of search results.

name: tabnew
description: Opens a new tab, optionally with a specified file.

name: Move Split to Tab
description: Moves the currently active split window into its own new tab.

name: gt / :tabn[ext]
description: Navigates to the next tab.

name: gT / :tabp[revious]
description: Navigates to the previous tab.

name: Go to Tab Number
description: Moves to the tab specified by the number #.

name: :tabm[ove]
description: Moves the current tab to the position specified by the number # (indexed from 0).

name: :tabc[lose]
description: Closes the current tab and all its associated windows.

name: :tabo[nly]
description: Closes all tabs except the currently active tab.

name: :tabdo
description: Runs the specified command on all open tabs.

name: :e[dit]
description: Opens a specified file for editing in a new buffer.

name: :bn[ext]
description: Switches to the next buffer.

name: :bp[revious]
description: Switches to the previous buffer.

name: :bd[elete]
description: Deletes a specified buffer, which effectively closes the associated file.

name: :b[uffer] #
description: Switches to the buffer identified by its index number.

name: :b[uffer] file
description: Switches to the buffer associated with the specified file name.

name: :ls / :buffers
description: Displays a list of all currently open buffers.

name: :sp[lit]
description: Opens a specified file in a new buffer and splits the window horizontally to display it.

name: :vs[plit]
description: Opens a specified file in a new buffer and splits the window vertically to display it.

name: :vert[ical] ba[ll]
description: Arranges all open buffers as vertical windows.

name: :tab ba[ll]
description: Opens all open buffers in separate tabs.

name: Split Window
description: Splits the current window horizontally, creating a new split.

name: Split Window Vertically
description: Splits the current window vertically, creating a new split.

name: Switch Windows
description: Switches the focus to the next window within the current split arrangement.

name: Quit Window
description: Closes the currently active window within a split arrangement.

name: Exchange Windows
description: Exchanges the position of the current window with the next one in the split arrangement.

name: Equalize Window Sizes
description: Resizes all windows in the current split arrangement to have equal height and width.

name: Move to Left Window
description: Moves the cursor to the window located to the left in a vertical split arrangement.

name: Move to Right Window
description: Moves the cursor to the window located to the right in a vertical split arrangement.

name: Move to Window Below
description: Moves the cursor to the window located below in a horizontal split arrangement.

name: Move to Window Above
description: Moves the cursor to the window located above in a horizontal split arrangement.

name: Maximize Window Height (Left)
description: Makes the current window occupy the full height of the screen and positions it as the leftmost window in a vertical split arrangement.

name: Maximize Window Height (Right)
description: Makes the current window occupy the full height of the screen and positions it as the rightmost window in a vertical split arrangement.

name: Maximize Window Width (Bottom)
description: Makes the current window occupy the full width of the screen and positions it as the bottommost window in a horizontal split arrangement.

name: Maximize Window Width (Top)
description: Makes the current window occupy the full width of the screen and positions it as the topmost window in a horizontal split arrangement.

name: zf
description: Manually defines a code fold from the current cursor position up to the specified motion.

name: zd
description: Deletes the code fold located under the cursor.

name: za
description: Toggles the open/closed state of the code fold located under the cursor.

name: zo
description: Opens (expands) the code fold located under the cursor.

name: zc
description: Closes (collapses) the code fold located under the cursor.

name: zr
description: Reduces the folding level by one, effectively opening folds at the outermost level.

name: zm
description: Increases the folding level by one, effectively closing folds at the current level.

name: zi
description: Toggles the folding functionality on or off.

name: ]c
description: Jumps to the start of the next change in the document.

name: [c
description: Jumps to the start of the previous change in the document.

name: do / :diffg[et]
description: Obtains (gets) the difference from another buffer and applies it to the current buffer.

name: dp / :diffpu[t]
description: Puts (applies) the difference from the current buffer to another buffer.

name: :diffthis
description: Marks the current window as part of the diff comparison.

name: :dif[fupdate]
description: Updates the displayed differences between buffers in diff mode.

name: :diffo[ff]
description: Disables diff mode for the current window.
